meanings.definition: Close and open one eye quickly, typically to convey a signal or message.
meanings.sent1: She was winking at her friend to let her know it was time to leave.
meanings.sent2: The traffic light was winking green, indicating it was safe to cross.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat kept winking at the dog, teasing it playfully.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the night sky seemed to be winking at me, as if sharing a secret.
meanings.sent5: His winking during the game made it clear he had a plan in mind.

meanings.definition: (of a light) Shine or flash intermittently.
meanings.sent1: The lighthouse was winking in the distance, guiding ships safely to shore.
meanings.sent2: The fireflies were winking in the dark, creating a magical atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The old lantern kept winking on and off, casting eerie shadows in the room.
meanings.sent4: The distant city lights were winking like stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The Christmas tree lights were winking cheerfully, spreading holiday joy.

meanings.definition: (of a person) Close and open one eye quickly, typically to convey a signal or message.
meanings.sent1: The detective was winking discreetly to his partner during the interrogation.
meanings.sent2: Grandpa enjoys winking at us mischievously when he tells his stories.
meanings.sent3: The comedian kept winking at the audience, making them laugh even more.
meanings.sent4: She was winking at her sister to share a secret without saying a word.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was winking at the student to reassure him during the test.
